instruction: [INST] Analyze this file to learn MacBook motherboard repair. The 'definitions' section explains key technical terms. The 'threads' section contains real-world repair discussions. Use both sections to understand and learn how to troubleshoot MacBook issues. Posts from username 'larossmann' , 'dukefawks' , and '2informaticos' are posts from trusted experts.[/INST]

definitions.820-00597: What is 820-00597? a LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER.

threads.title: Imac <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00597</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> not reading HDD correctly
threads.message:
I have on bench now iMac with have a weird HDD issue , it is showing unmounted HDD once I trying to format it will show the error. I get HDD working for a 10-15 min after replacement and issue come back. The machine come here with this problem not recognising HDD with was looking like dead HDD. 
Replaced HDD twice for brand new 
replaced hdd data cable 
replaced the 4 caps <CAPACITOR>C3821</CAPACITOR>, <CAPACITOR>C3822</CAPACITOR>,<CAPACITOR>C3823</CAPACITOR>,<CAPACITOR>C3824</CAPACITOR> suspecting issue there same issue persist 
I've measure the other connector J3830 
<SIGNAL>PP5V_S0_HDD</SIGNAL> -- 5V present 
<SIGNAL>SMC_OOB1_R2D_R_L</SIGNAL> -- 3.3V 
<SIGNAL>HDD_OOB1_D2R_L</SIGNAL> -- 0.013v jumping to 0.023V 

Thanks for help

threads.title: Imac <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00597</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> not reading HDD correctly
Imac <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00597</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> not reading HDD correctly
threads.message:
Hi Thanks for response,I replaced PCH just now to see as I have a new ones in stock, machine shows up HDD correctly and after reboot was same issue. 
I checked connection between PCH and SATA connector , they are okay. Also after fitting PCH there is a resistance on all 4 caps from PCH side. 
Any more ideas ?
 I am thinking about reball SMC.
It looks like loose connection after warming up board it started working? What do you think about SMC reball?
Do you think this value is correct ? <SIGNAL>HDD_OOB1_D2R_L</SIGNAL> -- 0.013v jumping to 0.023V

threads.title: Imac <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00597</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> not reading HDD correctly
threads.message:
You should compare the readings between working and non-working state.

SMC shouldn't be involved, but you can try reballing it.
Check if is possible to locate an PCB area reaction to heat.
